description:
Indiana Health Information Exchange's (IHIE) Solution Engineering team develops technologies that directly impact the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare. We are seeking a Solution Engineering Intern with experience in software design, implementation, testing, and debugging to work with the CareWeb team. Knowledge of the JAVA language is essential for all applicants. If you're talented, driven, and enjoy a little fun, you'll find IHIE to be a wonderful place to work.

Summary: The Solution Engineering Intern will work in an agile setting as a part of the CareWeb team on

  • Debugging, documenting, and testing existing java applications that interact with some of the largest medical data repositories in the world
  • Investigate and propose improvements to existing systems and applications
  • Build proof of concepts for new product ideas

Requirements:

  • Experience with Object Oriented methodology and best practices
  • Experience with JAVA programming language required
  • Experience working with version control systems (git, svn)
  • Experience with GOOGLE ANALYTICS preferred.

IHIE Attributes:

  • Adaptability and flexibility in a rapidly changing environment
  • Self-starter and self-motivated
  • Ambitious spirit – brings fresh ideas to the table and finds creative solutions to problems
  • Positive attitude with outstanding communication skills


Education:

  • Computer Science or related major required

Skills and Experience:

  • Aptitude to learn technologies quickly
  • Efficient time management and organizational skills
  • Professional demeanor
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both in verbal and written form
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions as well as manage ambiguity
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team of professionals at all levels

We offer an exciting opportunity to gain valuable, real-world experience while solving some very interesting challenges. We have a very casual work environment and dress code, all in a dynamic, fun-loving company culture!

IHIE is the nation's largest and most advanced health information exchange helping to ensure health information is where it needs to be, when it needs to be there to improve care coordination and patient outcomes. IHIE was formed in 2004 and currently serves over 90 hospitals and processes more than 14 million clinical data transactions each month. Learn more at www.ihie.org.

As a member of our Software Engineering development team, you will gain valuable experience in how to develop and deploy industry-leading software products in conjunction with our industry-first PanaCast multi-camera array systems and related products.

Design, develop, test and deploy industry-leading multi-camera products.

OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.


OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

Overview:
This internship position is to support the computer vision and machine learning team in the development of deep neural network solutions designed to run on our latest low-power AI chip Katana. The internship will include several exciting and challenging tasks, mostly focused on analysing the training\testing data, and designing and implementing creative techniques for improving and extending the data, including planning and conducting additional data collections and annotations, and running machine learning tools against the data. The intern will have significant interactions with the team members, and will have exposure to the latest computer vision and machine learning techniques.
Responsibilities:
  • Analyze the current training\testing data, and produce reports\spreadsheets\visualizations describing the data quality, coverage, features, and identify collection\labeling errors.
  • Design and implement creative scientific techniques for improving and extending the training\testing data.
  • Design and implement ways for improving data organization, storage, formats.
  • Design and implement creative techniques for improving the data collection process.
  • Organize and conduct new data collections.
  • Apply statistical, mathematical, and software skills to support machine learning model development.
  • Run ML training tools against the data.
  • Analyze the performance of the system, and summarize the failure patterns\areas of improvement.
Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled as a student, with 1+ years of relevant work experience in an accredited Bachelors, Masters or PhD program within the United States.
  • Majoring in computer engineering, computer science, or a relevant field.
  • Passion for machine learning, computer vision, and data analysis.
  • 1+ years of experience in coding in Python, and debugging skills.
  • Highly analytical, attentive to detail, curious, self-starter.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Team player

What we're looking for: We are seeking a talented intern who will participate and contribute to various software development projects in an Agile team environment.

Please submit a cover letter with your application.

What you'll do:

  • Assist in developing scalable, fast, robust, web-based solutions
  • Assist in implementing new features and optimizing existing ones to drive maximum performance
  • Perform unit and developer testing
  • Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from other developers, database teams, and project managers

What you'll need:

  • Be seeking a degree in Computer Science or similar (completed college sophomore-level or equivalent) or have similar work experience and/or education
  • Experience with or advanced coursework in Microsoft Office SharePoint, including design, programming, and integrating external components
  • Experience with modern programming languages (PHP, Node.js, Python, Java, .NET)
  • Experience with Web-related technologies including HTML/CSS and Java Script
  • Database/Data Storage experience (SQL/MySQL)
  • Excellent analytical capabilities
  • Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to effectively function in a fast-paced environment
  • Proactive self-starter with the ability to prioritize and clearly communicate priorities
  • Results oriented and deadline driven

What you'll get:

  • Experience working in an Agile team environment
  • Experience contributing to end-to-end software development projects
  • Experience with User Acceptance Testing
  • Experience using best-in-class tools in a real-world situation
  • Familiarity with a non-profit Association
  • Opportunity to work in a welcoming environment with a supportive team

Internship Criteria:

  • Internship is not eligible for sponsorship
  • Ability to work approximately 30 hours for the summer months (May-August, with flexibility)
  • Ability to work remotely and in our Oak Brook, IL office

Overview:
Stansberry Research is looking for an Engineering Intern to complement a team of technical professionals within Engineering. This is an exciting role that will have a direct impact in building a world class technology ecosystem sitting alongside a world class Marketing Business.

The Engineering Intern will be responsible for working within the engineering team on projects to further grow various aspects of the business. This role will assist and learn from full stack developers, business intelligence analysts, data engineers, data scientists and QA engineers. You will have an opportunity to use the latest cloud technology platforms in Data Warehouses, BI Tools, ETL Tools, along with the some of the most relevant SaaS based software in the industry. In addition to using the latest technology, you will learn marketing from a world class marketing organization.
Responsibilities:
  • Work with Engineering leadership and team members to deliver projects based on the current technology stack.
  • Work directly with end-users for requirements gathering, training, and on-boarding.
  • Review and assess the current state and identify improvement opportunities and best practice recommendations.
Qualifications:
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or similar.
  • Experience with standard program languages such as Python, Spring boot, Java, etc.
  • Proficiency in SQL a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Experience in a cloud based environment preferred.

About Stansberry Research:

At Stansberry Research, we thrive on new ideas and the entrepreneurial spirit. Naturally, we always look for new people, explorers, and innovators. If you are interested in a career where your ideas won't only be heard but rather celebrated, we'd like to hear from you.

Founded in 1999 and based in Baltimore, Maryland, Stansberry Research is the largest independent source of financial insight in the world. It delivers unbiased investment advice to self-directed investors seeking an edge in a wide variety of sectors and market conditions.

Stansberry Research has nearly two dozen analysts and researchers – including former hedge-fund managers and buy-side financial experts. They produce a steady stream of timely research on value investing, income generation, natural resources, biotech, financials, short-selling, macroeconomic analysis, options trading and more.

The company's uncompromised insight has made it one of the most respected and sought-after research organizations in the financial sector. Stansberry Research has nearly 1 million readers and more than 250,000 paid subscribers in well over 100 countries.

Keywords
Python, AngularJS, TypeScript, Node, Amazon Web Services, AWS, Lambda, Serverless, API Gateway, ElastiCache, Redis, EC2, Dynamo, PostgreSQL, RDS, MangoDB, NoSQL, Microservices, Caching, TDD,

Discover a POWERful career at Associated Electric! Our organization offers challenging and rewarding work with career development and internal mobility opportunities - all within a family friendly and community centric culture. Our purpose is simple - to provide safe, reliable and affordable energy for our member-owners. At Associated Electric, one of the largest electric cooperatives in the nation, opportunities to gain valuable experience and contribute new ideas in an ever-changing industry are endless.

We are currently seeking applicants for a Programming internship at our Headquarters facility in Springfield, Missouri. This is a paid internship and may be available for cooperative credit. This position offers part-time employment during fall 2021 with the opportunity to continue into spring 2022. Normal working days are Monday through Friday.

Qualified applicants must be currently enrolled in a computer science, computer information systems, computer engineering, or electrical engineering curriculum with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or greater. You must be enrolled in school during the internship. A candidate familiar with the latest Microsoft technologies (C#, .Net Core, SQL, Azure, RESTful Services, Reporting Services, Business Intelligence and SharePoint) is preferred.

These students will join our group of 20+ developers and application analysts to assist with the following:

  • Create and expand upon in-house developed software tools as well as the development of integrations with third-party products to support the effective running of our power grid.
  • Assist with the implementation, configuration, and expansion of capabilities of third-party products
  • Contribute to a full-stack development team and become familiar with software industry practices such as Dev Ops, Source Control, Build and Deploy Pipelines, Project Management, Product Management Service Oriented Architecture, and more!
  • Work directly with engineers, accountants, human resources, and other professionals to gather project requirements, tackle support requests, and implement new software products that will have lasting impacts long after your internship is complete!

Position Summary

Samsung is a world leader in Memory, LCD and System LSI technologies. We are currently looking for exceptional software and hardware talent to join our Samsung Austin R & D Center (SARC) in Austin, TX and our Advanced Computing Lab (ACL) in San Jose, CA. SARC was established in Austin, TX in 2010 to be one of Samsung’s strategic investments in high performance low power ARM based device technology. Presently our GPU design teams, located in Austin (SARC) and San Jose (ACL), are developing a GPU that will be deployed in Samsung mobile products. Our System IP team located in Austin (SARC) is working on Coherent Interconnect and memory controller architectures.

Managing a large, complex IT Infrastructure is no small task. Samsung SARC/ACL IT service operations works across many technologies and operates the current and next wave of infrastructure, application, platform and virtual technologies. As an IT Intern, you will support a variety of project based assignments working closely with our IT organization and team members across SARC/ACL.

Role and Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include:

  • Document Run Book and/or User portal for common issues
  • Adhere to all Samsung security protocols
  • Provide friendly customer support
  • Providing level 1 Linux system administration support to Engineering users
  • Hands-on server/hardware debugging and problem remediation
  • Monitor and maintain compute grid server availability and stability regularly
  • Interact and communicate with other IT teams for projects and ticket resolution
  • Service day to day internal team and end user work request tickets in timely manner
  • Automating routine IT manual tasks using bash scripting or Python scripting
  • Documenting day to day tasks, Runbooks, How-Tos, FAQs for end users and IT admins and follow run books
  • Reviewing, improving, and generating documentation for multiple areas within Engineering IT
  • Document Best Known Methods of resolution for streamlined support
  • Deploying Linux compute servers, Virtual machines or Containers based on Runbooks and user ticket requirements
  • Intern project work with significant automation tasks

Skills and Qualifications

Minimum requirements:

  • Pursuing a degree in Information Systems Management, Information Technology, Computer Science or related fields
  • Basic knowledge and familiarity with Linux, TCP/IP networking, or Windows.
  • Basic knowledge of scripting or programming. Python preferred
  • Basic Knowledge and familiarity with Linux command-line.
  • Basic understanding of networks
  • Basic understanding of computer and computer components
  • Desire to learn and to work with others
  • Customer service experience.

NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company.” We're looking to grow our company, and build our teams with the smartest people in the world. Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

NVIDIA is seeking an intern for the discovery and development of Deep Learning solutions for autonomous machines including robotics and real-time embedded applications. The individual will be responsible for the development and deployment of innovative AI IoT edge applications in the field of Computer Vision or natural language processing (NLP) on Jetson products. You will have chance to build your own innovative AI application from scratch which can start from gathering datasets, crafting data (sensor) pipeline, and building and deploying deep learning models.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Brainstorm ideas for computer vision and NLP applications on NVIDIA Jetson

  • Develop and experiment with deep learning models which can fit on embedded systems

  • Performance analysis and optimization using NVIDIA’s tools such as TensorRT

  • Build and deploy deep learning models on wheeled robots, robotic arms, etc.

What we need to see:

  • You are pursuing a PhD, MS, or BS in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

  • Proven experience working with at least one of the deep learning frameworks and programming languages such as Python, C++

  • Previous ROS background and PyTorch experience is a plus

  • Self-driven, motivated and enthusiastic to work on state-of-art machine learning tools

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Strong self-initiative, interpersonal skills, and resourcefulness with new technology

  • Excellent problem solving and partnership

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. About Oncology Analytics

Oncology Analytics is a leading data analytics and technology-enabled services company dedicated to helping health plans, providers, life sciences and patients with solutions that are purpose-built for oncology. Through an evidence-based, real-world analytics approach to utilization management, Oncology Analytics’ prior authorization platform is used by health plans and their network physicians to support 7 million health plan members in the US and Puerto Rico.

About the Role

The Engineering Intern works in an Agile environment with responsibilities for designing, coding, testing, insuring data integrity, and deploying and debugging software applications and services. This role will be responsible for working with product managers, technical program managers, software developers and quality engineers to help ensure high quality of services.

  • Design, develop, test, debug, deploy software solutions
  • Maintain development of software solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; following the software development lifecycle
  • Prepare and install solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming
  • Develop software testing procedures, programming, and documentation
  • Improve operations by conducting systems analysis
  • Provide production support for escalated issues
  • Perform validation and verification testing
  • Document development phases and monitor systems
  • Review and debug code

About You

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar engineering/analytical program.
  • 1 year of experience in software development or equivalent classwork.
  • Experience analyzing information, software design, software documentation, and testing are required skills, as well as general programming skills and software development fundamentals, development process, and requirements.
  • Experience working in a cloud environment with Azure or AWS platforms
  • Academic or practical experience with C#, .NET., SQL Server and any JavaScript framework is required.


About the Location


The majority of your team will be located in the Greater Atlanta area; however, we are open to remote work preferably in the Eastern or Central times zone.


Our Culture


Taking ownership of quick action, critically thinking through the needs, and working well with others are key competencies of team member success. Our leadership is dedicated to building a culture based on respect, clinical excellence, innovation – all with a focused mission of putting patients first!


We offer a full benefit package starting on your first day, along with a company bonus and equity so you can experience the value of our growth along with the rest of the team. You will work from (or visit) our very modern and engaging offices, and experience a fun, collaborative environment where social activities and community events matter. We enjoy being together!


The Opportunity


The cost of cancer related medical services and prescription drugs in the United States is expected to reach $246 billion by 2030. Oncology Analytics has enjoyed rapid growth over the past 3 years and seeks smart, collaborative people to join its team. We have just under 200 team members, so we can move swiftly but precisely to the market needs of our customers. Strongly backed financially by leading healthcare equity partners, we remain in an investment mode. This means we are open-minded to how we get the work done – now is the perfect time to talk to us!


Our Current Solutions


Through the use of Oncology Analytics’ utilization management system, OneUM, our customers can use a single e-Prior Authorization portal for all oncology drug request and treatments. Our system improves quality of care, reduces provider abrasion and gives health plans visibility into the total cost of oncology treatment.


Oncology Analytics offers Oncology Insights Pro, an analytic software solution that enables health plans to use data and analytics to improve oncology programs. Using real world data, our engineers normalize data to create analytic dashboards with drill down compatibilities. The data is the paired with expert guidance providing the strategies an insight needed to keep up with the continuing evolving cancer treatment landscape.


Oncology Analytics offers Pharmacy Consulting services to health plans and pharmaceutical companies. New cancer treatments are entering the market at an unrelenting pace. Since 2018, the FDA approved 121 new cancer applications including 49 novel cancer drug entities. Our Board-Certified Oncology Pharmacologists can help health plans update drug policies, offer utilization management and formulary advice, and development training for staff.


Our digital health solution is coming soon. Stay tuned!

What will I be doing?

As an ORISE participant, you will join a community of scientists and researchers in an effort to apply knowledge, skill, and ability (KSA) in developing web-based information system solutions, in accordance with the Department of Defense (DoD) Risk Management Framework for the Joint Acquisition Chem-Bio Knowledge System (JACKS) project. DEVCOM CBC will provide hands-on experience allowing you to enhance your skills in Microsoft .Net Framework, and .Net Core using the C# programming language, JavaScript, and various UI frameworks such as Bootstrap, and JQuery.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience, attend specialized classes and technical seminars to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. During your appointment you will learn how to apply the KSA for developing software in the DoD environment and develop data auditing routines that adhere to the the Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) for Application Software. In addition, your mentor will develop personal learning objectives in accordance to your professional goals.

Additional learning objectives will include:

  • Apply communication skills to understand requirements, use cases, and propose new and innovative solutions to business analysts, and software development team leaders.
  • Experience unit testing in a Microsoft development environment and have the opportunity to propose improvements to software code unit testing.
  • Acquire skills developing information system user role functions, data integrity, and application availability monitoring and reporting.
  • Analyze, evaluate, and provide briefings on new technology proposals, trends, and concepts with emphasis on cybersecurity and system improvements

Where will I be located? Rock Island, Illinois

What is the anticipated start date?

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is ready to make appointments immediately. Exact start dates will be determined at the time of selection and in coordination with the selected candidate. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis and internships will be filled as qualified candidates are identified.

Appointment Length

This appointment is a twelve month, part-time research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location. Other benefits may include the following:

  • Health Insurance Supplement. Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE.
  • Relocation Allowance
  • Training and Travel Allowance

Nature of Appointment

You will not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD, or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment.

About DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center

The DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center is the primary Department of Defense technical organization for non-medical chemical and biological defense. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center possesses an unrivaled chemical biological research and development infrastructure with scientists, engineers, technician, and specialists located at four different sites in the United States. DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center has a unique role in technology development that cannot be duplicated by private industry or research universities. It fosters research, development, testing, and application of technologies for protecting Warfighters, first responders, and the nation from chemical and biological warfare agents. For more information about the DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center, please visit https://www.cbc.ccdc.army.mil/.

Qualifications

Candidates should be actively pursuing a bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree with the intent to graduate between May 2021 - May 2024 in one of the following areas: Computer Information System, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related information technology degree. Associate degree candidates will also be considered. Please note: undergraduate students must be Registar Office documented sophomores, juniors and seniors.

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET clearance is required. While participants will not enter into an employment relationship with DoD or any other agency, this opportunity will require a suitability investigation/background investigation. Any offer made is considered tentative pending favorable outcome of the investigation.
  • Currently have, or obtain within 6 months from starting the opportunity with the government, one of the following DoD 8570.01-M IAT Level I Certifications: A+ CE - CCNA-Security - CND - Network+ CE - SSCP
  • Complete a computing environment course such as a Microsoft Developer course within 6 months from starting the opportunity.

A complete application consists of:

  • Zintellect Profile
  • Educational and Employment History
  • Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
  • Resume (PDF)
  • Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.
  • One Recommendation

Submitted documents must have all social security numbers, student identification numbers, and/or dates of birth removed (blanked out, blackened out, made illegible, etc.) prior to uploading into the application system. All documents must be in English or include an official English translation.

If you have questions, send an email to ARMY-RDECOM@orise.orau.gov. Please list the reference code of this opportunity CCDC-CBC-2021-0005 in the subject line of the email.

WHO WE ARE:
We think too much marketing isn't us. It's mass markets not audiences of one. Homogenous groups to be targeted, not individuals to be inspired. Segments to reach, not people with their own ideas and ambitions. It's one size fits all and it's dull.

When it comes to individuals, we're fierce. We stand up for individuality. We speak up against bland, broad-brush generalizations. We fight for solutions that adapt to the individual's needs, beliefs, behaviors and aspirations. And we commit to doing this in every aspect of our work for clients and their consumers.

We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency's vision. And most importantly we value every individual's wellbeing.

We are Fiercely Individual.
As a guiding ethos, RAPP stands up for Individuality. So much so, that it's in our agency value proposition. We're committed to racial justice, equality, representation and unbiased economic opportunity, because we know that the strength of our diversity helps us create our best work. And we believe in harnessing the strength of all our Fiercely Individual people, and the differences among us, because that's the surest way to positively impact our business and network culture.

HOW WE DO IT:
At RAPP, we are fiercely focused on the individual and how we can create value from every individual's experience with a brand. We do this across three capability areas: customer centric consulting, creativity that inspires action, and customer experience management.

Our data analysts know who that person is. Our strategists understand what they want. And our award-winning Technologists and Creatives know how to get it to them.

RAPP is an integral part of Omnicom's Precision Marketing Group, comprising 4,000 creatives, technologists, strategists, and data and marketing scientists across 40 global markets.

THE INTERNSHIP:
In this 10-week program, our interns will work on client business (roughly 75% of time) and participate in an open-brief creative project (roughly 25% of time). Interns will support teams on the day-to-day client business (varied by department). Additionally, they will develop a collaborative creative project centered on a real-world problem. Each team will receive the appropriate resources, including mentors, to accomplish their goal and complete assignments. Our interns are sharp, and can think both strategically and creatively no matter what discipline they're assigned to.

We are in the business of relationships. We are problem solvers who work to identify opportunities and hone in on solutions that enhance and grow our client's business.

A current full-time graduate student

A recent graduate

Job Summary


We are looking for a highly motivated and practical candidate to support the engineering requirements of Mobile Software Engineering for the Kwikset, Baldwin, and Weiser product brands.

Working closely with Senior Mobile Software Engineer, the Mobile Software Engineer Intern will design, build, and support smart lock applications for iOS and/or android platform. At the end or your internship, you will present your accomplishments and results to the Engineering Leadership team.

About this role:
KBI Biopharma is looking for an intern to join the cell culture process development team. The intern will be responsible for conducting remote (virtual only) data analysis and presenting data analysis. No active lab work will be performed during this internship. Main responsibilities will include:
  • Compare antifoam addition data between different bioreactor scales across 3-5 cell lines to identify scale dependency
  • Summarize findings from antifoam addition comparison in 15-minute presentation to the upstream cell culture team
  • Perform data entry for 30 completed cGMP manufacturing bioreactor runs with a goal to develop process output database
  • Learn basics of biologics manufacturing
Outcomes:
  • Be able to describe antifoam addition for various production bioreactor scales with basic statistics
  • Become familiar with the mechanism of foam formation and use of antifoam in a mammalian cell culture production process
  • Learn about importance of process database development and data mining
Essential skills:
  • Enthusiasm and willingness to learn and ask questions
  • Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently
  • Good interpersonal skills and communication
  • Good computer skills (Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
If you are interested in this position, please send your resume in pdf format to jkim@kbibiopharma.com or nbubna@kbibiopharma.com from 26th April to 07th May 2021. Interested students will be contacted for 15-minute virtual interviews in May 2021.
About KBI Biopharma:
KBI Biopharma is a fast-growing, Science-Driven and Customer-Focused contract development & manufacturing organization (CDMO) serving the global biopharmaceutical industry. KBI’s business model is designed from the ground up to help clients accelerate their path to market while reducing risk and building value. Our customers range from small biotech to global biopharmaceutical companies as well as academic and non-profit organizations. In every client testimonial we’ve received and in every client survey we’ve seen, we are proud to report that KBI is viewed as the most collaborative and responsive of all the CDMOs with whom our clients work.
KBI has an extensive track record of success in developing robust and scalable processes for cGMP manufacturing for a wide range of recombinant proteins for our clients. The Company has proven expertise in developing upstream and downstream processes, analytics and formulations, scale-up, technology transfer, and cGMP manufacture of protein-based therapeutics for pre-clinical and clinical manufacturing, process optimization and characterization, process performance qualification, and commercial launch production. To date, we have served over 250 clients globally.
The mammalian cell culture laboratories and pilot-scale operations are state-of-the-art. Single-use bioreactors ranging from 15 mL to 200 L are employed for process development and tech transfer projects. Well characterized ambr15 and ambr250 bioreactors from Sartorius along with the Xcellerex Single-use bioreactors (XDR-50 and XDR-200) are used as the mainstay of mammalian cell culture process development at KBI. High throughput equipment like Bio HT (Roche), Vi-CELL and blood gas analyzers are used for offline testing of cell culture samples.

Job Description


We are looking for an energetic intern who has a passion for technology and working with gaming and media applications across multiple platforms. In this internship you will work with a dynamic team that pulls together compelling demos that showcase the features of Intel's latest platforms. We create new usages and experiences and show Intel's competitive advantage on PC's and mobile devices.

We collaborate with marketing, engineering, sales and development groups to make sure we have the best examples of software that makes hardware shine - and our work directly affects the sales of Intel client platforms. Once we have created these experiences, we collaborate with different parts of the company and we participate in trade shows to evangelize them. In this internship you will gain expertise in the client software ecosystem and how to develop marketing and sales collateral to support the platform value proposition.

The internship entails evaluating different candidate applications and workloads to identify the best examples that show differentiation on Intel's platforms from a performance, power, usability perspective, then weaving a story and a demo to showcase them, followed by creation of assets so that our field and sales organizations can recreate and repurpose the demos and show them to external customers.

For this you need strong technical and communication skills, as you will translate engineering specifications into customer benefits and test and generate workloads to communicate these benefits effectively. We look for self-motivated, creative and disciplined individuals who are good listeners, collaborators and communicators and who take a personal interest in tinkering with hardware.

About the Opportunity

Being a data scientist at Pitney Bowes is different from other companies. First of all, our expectations of interns is to experience all aspects of the role, not just the technical aspects. You will focus on working with customers, product managers, management stakeholders, as well as data engineers and, of course, our team of data scientists. You also will get an experience to work with our Design team, a unique fusing of skills that integrates data and design.

Using our Data Science Workstation environment, a data science intern will have access to Pitney Bowes’s data from across the company made available through Fusion, our proprietary data lake built with all the technology and computing power of the Amazon cloud. You will leverage our enterprise mailing and shipping data to profile prospects and customers, optimize equipment usage, model networks and optimize supply chains. You also be engaged with projects empowering a holistic customer experience. You will work alongside practitioners to help orchestrate and deliver solutions combining datasets with your modeling and analysis driving meaningful insights.

About Us

The Commerce Cloud Data group is a part of the Pitney Bowes Innovation unit. As an organization we focus on building new products and supporting our Lines of Business to deliver shipping and delivery services. As the Data group our main function is to develop and maintain the Pitney Bowes data lake, and to use its data and technologies to deliver value to teams across the company. We are a team of developers, architects, data engineers, security experts, data scientists, designers and business analysts who see the potential in data driven products and solutions. We’re based out of Stamford, CT and Shelton, CT.

About You

We take pride in our internship programs. Many participants will choose to continue with Pitney Bowes upon graduation. Our selection process is therefore focused on the highest quality candidates that demonstrate a rigorous academic curriculum as well as having established themselves with authentic projects pursued in and outside the classroom. As a PB Data Science intern you are someone who is:


Social: While you will have the full support of our data science team, you will be encouraged to work directly with our business teams. You will develop the skills to explain how models work in both technical and business terms across stakeholders. Your presentation skills will help you stand out and get recognized!


Confident: Even though this internship may be your first, the data science team prides itself on helping you build confidence in expressing ideas with a fresh pair of eyes. Several projects pursued by interns have become the basis for actual work when they were eventually hired.

Curious: Being inquisitive is essential to having a successful internship. While you’re working on projects, we encourage you to speak up and ask meaningful questions that challenge assumptions and outcomes. Over time we anticipate you’ll be the first to respond to inquiries. In previous years some of the most valuable outcomes stemmed from observations by people just like you. We’re not afraid to take projects in a whole new direction.

Analytical: Being able to support your claims with evidence is critical to the success of our team and to the success of a data scientist’s career. We’re looking for someone who is very thorough and rigorous in their analysis and can design their own approach to solving a problem. We’ll challenge you along the way and you’ll become bold in how you uncover ideas and present solutions.

Ambitious: We start new projects all the time. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to pursue projects in different ways. We encourage you to take charge, use new technologies, apply different methods, and offer innovative solutions to our group. Our ideal candidate is self-driven and can contribute extensively to guiding the direction of our project development.


Qualifications


Qualifications

  • Pursuing (or completion of) a bachelor’s or advanced degree in a quantitative discipline
  • Strong quantitative and analytic skills in Probability, Statistics, Operations Research, and Machine Learning.

Company Description

Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.

Job Description

::

Microchip is the leader in research and manufacture of high-reliability non-volatile Field Programmable Gate Arrays.

description:
Founded by a small group of educators, Michigan Schools & Government Credit Union (MSGCU) has been providing quality financial services to the community for more than 65 years. Following our mission of being a caring organization dedicated to promoting financial success for our members, we have grown to be the 6th largest Credit Union in Michigan. We have also been honored as a Top Workplace by The Detroit Free Press eight years in a row.

If you have a passion for helping people and providing exceptional and dependable service, we want you on our team!

Overview of Responsibilities: The IT Help Desk Internship will provide a valuable opportunity to learn and gain hands-on experience in entry level IT in the financial services industry. The IT Help Desk Intern will be given the opportunity to assist with IT help desk calls and provide technical software, hardware, and network problem resolution for all MSGCU team members by performing problem diagnosis and guiding users through step-by-step solutions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provides IT help desk support for all MSGCU team members in areas such as hardware and software. Ensures problems are resolved quickly without significant interruption to member service.
  • Clearly communicates technical solutions in a user-friendly, professional manner and provides one-on-one end-user training as needed.
  • Diagnoses and resolves PC hardware and software problems including printing, peripherals, hardware, and software performance.
  • Completes the morning health checks of systems
  • Organizes storage and server room.
  • Assists with deploying new image with latest drivers and updates.
  • Patches in the servers and patch panel for new branch location and labels them appropriately.
  • Assists Network Engineers with installing rack and mounting switches and other hardware.
  • Sets up new hire laptop, iPad, iPhone, and printers etc.
  • Assists in creating and maintaining user profiles/passwords on the network and e-mail systems.
  • Assists with user access problems such as user password resets and user account unlock.
  • Assists with managing and monitoring branch hardware, PC workstation, and peripheral inventory.
  • Maintains, supports, deploys, and tracks hardware and software assets.
  • Provides phone support for members using Interaction Desktop.
  • Performs periodic preventative maintenance on desktop computers and branch equipment.
  • Assists IT Technicians with configuration and deployment of PC hardware and peripherals.
  • Assists with installation and maintenance of software programs on desktop and laptop computers.
  • Coordinates timely repair of MSGCU communication circuits by reporting trouble to appropriate third party vendors and monitoring status of any open repair tickets.

Essential Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Member Focus: Uses active listening skills to gain insight and understanding into the needs of team members to troubleshoot and resolve problems.
  • Action Oriented: Takes on new opportunities, unfamiliar tasks, and tough challenges with a sense of urgency and enthusiasm. Prioritizes and separates work into efficient workflows and effectively deploys IT resources. Holds self-accountable to meet commitments, helps others achieve objectives, and persists despite obstacles or setbacks.
  • Communicates Effectively: Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical audiences; readily adapts approach based on the situation.
  • Instills Trust: Builds relationships and gains the confidence of others by modeling honesty, integrity, authenticity, and behaviors that align with organizational values. Exemplifies courage by stepping up to address difficult issues.
  • Self-Development: Learns quickly through experimentation when facing new situations and actively seeks new ways to grow using formal and informal development channels.
  • Above average knowledge of computer hardware (desktop and peripherals)
  • Average or better knowledge of Information Technology, including backups, redundancy, security, etc.

Essential Preparation and Experience:

  • 2 semesters of IT-related coursework; and
  • 1 year of customer service experience; and
  • Availability for up to 30 hours per week.
  • Duration of Internship expected to be through December, 2021.

Working Conditions:

  • Office and branch location environment with little discomfort from noise, extreme temperature, dust, or other factors.
  • Required to travel throughout MSGCU's service area as business needs require.
  • Exposed to potentially hazardous conditions, such as robbery. Receives detailed instructions and security procedures on an annual basis to minimize risk.
  • This work involves sitting most of the time with brief periods of walking or standing and may occasionally require lifting and/or moving up to 30 pounds.
  • Normal working hours will be MSGCU’s standard branch and administrative office hours of operation, however, occasional after-hours maintenance and flexibility to be on call before/after normal work hours, including weekends and holidays, is required.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

  • Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
  • Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
  • Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


The SAP Innovation Center is looking for a highly motivated full-stack software development intern to join the team for an internship. This is a remote position for pacific time zone. In case the situation permits, office visits in Palo Alto, CA and Newport Beach, CA will be possible. In this role, you will be able to work on a variety of cutting-edge technologies and projects, such as blockchain, self-sovereign identity, data science and machine learning projects.


The SAP Innovation Center is a global and diverse team with locations around the world. You will get the opportunity to build and contribute to solutions that future-proof SAP.


https://icn.sap.com/


What you’ll do:


Position title: SAP Innovation Center Intern – Software Developer
Location: Palo Alto, California
Expected start date: June 2021


In this role, you’ll:

  • Develop full-stack applications using state of the art frameworks
  • Be a contributor in an agile project team with SCRUM setup
  • Work with stakeholders and team members in solving complex problems
  • Design and develop front-end interfaces, RESTful APIs and backend systems
  • Learn about cutting-edge technologies such as blockchain, self-sovereign identity, or machine learning applications
  • Integrate solutions into SAP enterprise software


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Strong programming skills in either Python, JavaScript, or Java
  • Candidates to currently be enrolled in a master’s degree program which is applicable to the position (computer science or equivalent proven experience)
  • Experience building web applications
  • Strong communication skills that include the ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment working with multiple teams across various geographies
  • Preferred experience: familiarity with front-end frameworks, micro service architecture, cloud applications (AWS, GCP), SQL, Docker, GitHub


Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

The Primary Role of this position is:

Working with a mentor, develop test programs for debugging, characterizing and production testing next-generation AMD processors. Work on Automated Test Equipment (ATE) platforms and System Level Test (SLT) platforms. Debug test infrastructure issues including test hardware, test software, and product-specific IP. Develop software tools and scripts that support Test process.

Support overall compatibility, compliance, and test coverage of processors from product definition through product qualification and into high volume production by developing product specific test hardware, software and diagnostics. The test platforms and test infrastructure use various coding and scripting languages like Java, C++, C, Python, PERL, and Ruby to manipulate the device under test to ensure proper device functionality.

Potential roles of a Product Development Co-op include:

  • Develops and implements test programs/software to test and analyze AMD products.
  • Develops test requirements and specifications.
  • Develops software tools and scripts that support test process, program debug/audit, test time analysis etc.
  • Performs logic and circuit design verification via software and hardware.
  • Works with product engineering, characterization and platform debug teams to define and debug existing and new products.
  • Debugs test infrastructure issues in hardware, software, device, or manufacturing flow domains.
  • Support product improvement activities including driving cost reduction and yield improvement initiatives and resolving quality issues.
  • Works on related projects and/or assignments as needed.

Qualifications:

Years of experience and education: Candidates will be enrolled in a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering.

Required Skills:

  • Experience with C++ or other high-level software programming languages (Java, C, C#)
  • Courses in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Digital Logic, Circuit Theory
  • Familiar with Linux or Unix Operating Systems
  • Familiar with Microsoft standard apps (i.e. Office), Microsoft Windows Operating Systems

Preferred Skills:

  • Scripting language experience with Perl, Ruby, shell script, or similar
  • Experience in the XP, AGILE, Scrum, and/or Kanban programming paradigms.

Experience with revision control (SVN, CVS,RCS or similar) on a large software project

Will have connections (API) to Shopify (and Vendors integrated with Shopify) that will allow data relevant to end-users and Company to be pulled, displayed, and filtered. Ability to provide payouts from Company Paypal account directly to user's payment preference in their account settings.

Theme, working integrations with Shopify showing the corresponding user’s accumulative revenue, past revenue by month and current revenue for the month. Links for “Geeks Tier Subscription” services integrated (Link leading to application page, will be provided).

Vital Strategies, headquartered in New York City, is an international public health organization that strengthens public health systems and addresses the world’s leading causes of illness, injury, and death. Position Overview:
Nationwide IT Services (NIS) is seeking summer 2021 interns for our program supporting one of our key corporate initiatives. As an intern, you will work in a team environment delivering a working technical solution that can be leveraged for use by various existing customers and other government agencies.

Program Summary:
Work will consist of a wide range of project tasks to include web application design and development, database scripting, code reviews, technical documentation, and research into existing and emerging technologies. position: 2022 - Summer - Consulting Intern- Application Development - Ground Up
description:
Technology Consulting- Application Development Intern

At RSM, Application Development interns work with large and small companies in various industries. They develop strong working relationships with clients built on understanding their businesses and challenges. As an intern, you will work on multiple team engagements each year, including several pieces of any particular assignment - not just one part. Working in a mutually respectful team environment helps our associates perform at their best and integrate their career with their personal life.

As an intern in the Application Development practice, you will work with the team to learn and implement design changes to existing systems and integrate new systems into our client’s infrastructure. Maintaining data integrity procedures, processes and policies is essential as well as a desire to take a hands-on approach to troubleshooting and data cleanup as necessary.

Examples of the candidate’s responsibilities include:
Design and document specifications for data integrations
Coordinate with client lead users and client engineering teams to test and implement new or modified programs as needed
Document requirements and assist in ERP/CRM development in creating ERP/CRM customizations
Develop a deeper knowledge on proper coding technique

Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field required
Strong conceptual, analytic and problem solving skills
Database Design experience
Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously
Must be a team player and be able to effectively communicate with staff at all levels of the firm
Travel to assigned client locations is required. Must have access to and ability to arrange for use of reliable modes of transportation to those locations
A minimum 3.0 GPA is preferred

Software, CRM or ERP experience

Experience with any/all of the following:
SSRS
MOSS/SharePoint Services
Microsoft CRM SDK
Programming languages such as VB.net, C#, ASP.NET, and JavaScript
Experience with data integration tools
Experience with Agile methodologies a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work as an effective member of a team
Motivated to work in a fast-paced environment

You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.

Company Description:
We are a trusted government partner that blends deep domain expertise with advanced technologies to help our customers solve complex problems that improve, protect, and save lives. As a rapidly growing company, we combine entrepreneurial spirit, customer focus, and an outcomes-based approach to support agency missions in health IT, life sciences, public safety, and grants management.

The Dovel Family of Companies offers employees an opportunity to advance beyond a specific role or contract, we offer a path to develop an enriching career. We believe in empowering a culture of innovation, customer success, and employee growth.


What you’ll get…

  • Time Off! Flexible schedules and company paid holidays allow you to take the time you need.
  • Investment in YOU! 401(K) company contributions are yours to keep with no waiting period.
  • Choices! Unique healthcare plans to choose from with options like fertility and orthodontia benefits.
  • Discovery! With our tuition assistance and training programs, we support your career advancement.
  • Tax Savings! Enroll in pre-tax Health or Dependent Care Flexible Spending, HSA with company contributions, parking, and/or transit commuter benefits.
  • Support! Working parents and busy professionals – we’ve got you covered with a supportive culture, confidential Employee Assistance Program, and membership to Care.com.
  • Perks! Employee discounts, peer recognition programs, company-wide wellness challenges, and fun community events.
  • A Voice! A unique culture where you can influence decisions and have your voice heard.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer with a commitment to diversity. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineering Interns to join our engineering teams in our San Francisco office.
As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs the world’s largest AI-driven insights and measurement platform directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. Using machine learning to drive human learning, Quantcast provides brand marketers and publishers with meaningful audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions across the customer journey.
As a part of the Software Engineering Internship program, you will lead a specialized project while having the mentorship of Engineers from different technical backgrounds. These Engineers have a real passion for technology, solving significant problems, and want to make a tangible impact.
You’ll have the opportunity to learn software engineering best practices and own projects from start to finish with teams that specialize in machine Learning, distributed storage systems, big data platforms, API development and data visualization.

Responsibilities

    • Our unique 10 to 12 weeks summer internship program provides you with a comprehensive introduction to the ad tech industry while being fully integrated into a team
    • You will have full project ownership and the autonomy to build impactful products. At the end of your internship, you will present your project to the entire engineering organization
    • We will pair you with a dedicated mentor on your team to ensure the success of your project. They will be your go-to person for any questions, suggestions, advice, and educational feedback
    • You will engage with executives and industry leaders through intern and company wide events. We believe in order to grow and be successful having access to all resources is key!
    • You will participate in fun and memorable events with fellow interns, mentors, and full-timers. Past events have included Cable Car Trolley Tours, volunteering, CAL Academy, scavenger hunts, and Giants games. While we do work hard we love to have fun!
    • We offer perks, which include intern housing stipend, snacks and drinks, catered lunches, dinners & weekly happy hours

Requirements

    • Excellent command of one or more programming languages: Java, C++ or Python
    • Deep understanding of algorithms and data structures
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
    • Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science or related field
    • Graduation date between Dec 2020 and June 2022
Quantcast is an advertising technology company and the creator of an innovative intelligent audience platform that empowers brands, agencies and publishers to know and grow their audiences online. Our solutions are leveling the playing field for our customers when it comes to effectively reaching audiences online and helping them power a thriving free and open internet for everyone. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Francisco, Quantcast has employees in 20 offices across 10 countries.

We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone can be their authentic self. The Ultra Engineering function manages a portfolio of specialist capabilities, generating highly differentiated solutions and products by applying electronic, mechanical, and software technologies in demanding and critical environments to meet customer needs.

Job Description:
Ultra Electronics Naval Systems and Sensors is searching for a highly motivated and detail oriented Software Engineering Intern to support the development of an existing Radar system. Working closely with program leads and system engineering, the Software Engineering Intern will support the development of the Radar System through design, development, and finally the integration and test events. This role will include significant development and testing of systems and test tools in addition to traditional software development activities. The Software Engineer will have the opportunity to support the development and selection of key technologies for the Navy and will have the opportunity to work with complex software algorithms and cutting-edge digital signal processing hardware.
Required Skills:
  • Currently at least a Sophomore enrolled in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related engineering discipline, ideally with a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Ability to obtain a US Government security clearance. Security clearances are granted to U.S. citizens.
Desired Skills:
  • Development with a major object-oriented programming language such as C++ (preferred) and/or Java
  • Use of proper coding practices through the development life cycle
  • UML or other design modeling techniques
  • Linux-based operating systems and code development
  • Development using basic editors such as VI, emacs, Gedit, etc.
  • Working with a team to jointly develop a system during all phases of the development lifecycle
  • Strong attention to detail and work ethic
  • Working knowledge of the use of third party tools to do code coverage, memory leak, and other code integrity checks
  • Knowledge or understanding of Qt programming

Ultra specialises in providing application-engineered bespoke solutions. We focus on our customers’ mission critical and intelligent systems in the defence, security, critical detection & control markets. Our capabilities and technologies can be found on many of the world’s long-term military programmes. We employ over 4,500 employees across the globe and are listed on the London Stock Exchange. Ultra operates mainly as a Tier 3 (sub-system) and occasionally a Tier 2 systems provider, in the Maritime, C3 (Communications, Command and Control) and Cyber, military and commercial aerospace, nuclear and industrial sensors markets. We use both research and development, to provide innovative, mission specific bespoke technological solutions to our customer’s most complex problems. Learn more by visiting our website: https://www.ultra.group/

Andor Health is seeking an intern with experience in software design, coding and debugging. The intern will gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company. position: 2022 - Summer - Consulting Intern- Application Development - Ground Up
description:
Technology Consulting- Application Development Intern

At RSM, Application Development interns work with large and small companies in various industries. They develop strong working relationships with clients built on understanding their businesses and challenges. As an intern, you will work on multiple team engagements each year, including several pieces of any particular assignment - not just one part. Working in a mutually respectful team environment helps our associates perform at their best and integrate their career with their personal life.

As an intern in the Application Development practice, you will work with the team to learn and implement design changes to existing systems and integrate new systems into our client’s infrastructure. Maintaining data integrity procedures, processes and policies is essential as well as a desire to take a hands-on approach to troubleshooting and data cleanup as necessary.

Examples of the candidate’s responsibilities include:
Design and document specifications for data integrations
Coordinate with client lead users and client engineering teams to test and implement new or modified programs as needed
Document requirements and assist in ERP/CRM development in creating ERP/CRM customizations
Develop a deeper knowledge on proper coding technique

Basic Qualifications:
Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS or related field required
Strong conceptual, analytic and problem solving skills
Database Design experience
Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, and work on multiple projects simultaneously
Must be a team player and be able to effectively communicate with staff at all levels of the firm
Travel to assigned client locations is required. Must have access to and ability to arrange for use of reliable modes of transportation to those locations
A minimum 3.0 GPA is preferred

Preferred Qualifications:
Software, CRM or ERP experience

Experience with any/all of the following:
SSRS
MOSS/SharePoint Services
Microsoft CRM SDK
Programming languages such as VB.net, C#, ASP.NET, and JavaScript
Experience with data integration tools
Experience with Agile methodologies a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work as an effective member of a team
Motivated to work in a fast-paced environment

You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.

Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.

RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

Who Are We?

QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy.

The combined QinetiQ U.S. business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat.

We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad.

Your Contribution to Our Mission:

QinetiQ Inc. is offering summer internship opportunities to exceptional students from the following disciplines: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering, Systems Engineering, Physics, and Math. Successful candidates will work alongside industry leaders in the development of advanced technology development in support of the military and warfighter effort.

  • Learn about how the business functions and how you may become a valuable asset to the company if you were to be brought on in a full-time employment capacity
  • Assist in the design and build of advanced technology systems
  • Participate in special projects as required

To Land This Job, You Need:

  • To be a current Bachelor's or Master's Degree student at an accredited US institution, preferably majoring in an engineering or technical field
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent organizational skills

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:

DOD Secret


Why QinetiQ Inc.?

  • Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces.
  • Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.
  • Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement.
  • We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry.
  • We have fun! We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments.
  • We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options.

No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.


Accessibility/Accommodation:

If because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to staffing@us.qinetiq.com or call (540) 658-2720 Opt 4 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

QinetiQ Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

When it comes to using cutting-edge machine learning to tackle complex problems, Lockheed Martin is driven by a singular mission focus and desire to continuously innovate. Today’s challenges to global security aren’t just changing – they’re accelerating faster than ever before. Through our dedication to our mission, our AI-enabled systems are changing the way we design, manufacture and sustain our products.

Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (LM MFC) is seeking an AI Engineer intern for an exciting position to be based in Orlando, FL that will support the Digital Transformation (DX) initiatives within our Quality Operations and Advanced Quality Technologies (AQT) team.

This role will require knowledge and/or coursework in topics such as software engineering, artificial intelligence, machine learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to support the Advanced Quality and Digital Transformation project portfolio, focusing on a broad range of projects across the Digital Transformation.
The selected candidate will focus on assisting with the development of technologies and products that leverage Artificial Intelligence to provide discriminating capability to our customers. The selected candidate can expect to utilize current AI paradigms including computer vision, deep learning, and reinforcement learning, applying these techniques to help solve complex problems and field innovative solutions.

Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time management and interpersonal skills.

Must be a US Citizen.
Basic Qualifications:
  • Coursework in Engineering, Computer Science from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience.
  • Must be a US Citizen
Desired Skills:
  • Experience using machine learning frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, MxNet, Caffe, etc.)
  • Experience with Python and multiple libraries (NumPy, OpenCV, Scikit, Pandas, etc.)
  • Experience with C++, Java, GO, and other compiled languages
  • Familiarity with DevOps tools: Docker, Git [GitLab, GitHub], Continuous Integration [CI], Continuous Deployment [CD]
  • Familiarity with modern Computer Vision
  • Familiarity with high-performance computing
  • Familiarity with network/messaging (UDP, ZeroMQ, RESTful API, etc.)
  • Familiarity interfacing with databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.)
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
job.Qualifications

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.
