Company Summary

TechnipFMC is a global oil and gas leader, specialized in subsea and surface technologies. Our mission: to enhance the performance of world’s energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions and investing in our 23 000+ employees, across 48 countries. At TechnipFMC, we aim to offer an inspiring working experience: tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges in the world in collaboration with a truly global team.


PURPOSE:
This position fulfills the purpose of an intern level software design engineering position. It includes limited responsibility for the testing and/or modification of code for assigned engineering design and development projects which may include legacy, new and improved products/systems and analysis of OEM products. Responsibilities include ensuring that the product function and accuracy meet the specified requirements as assigned.

Participates in engineering solutions as part of a NMP/PLM projects, in accordance with TechnipFMC standards, procedures, processes, schedules, and budget, with a continuous concern for quality, targets, and customer satisfaction.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:
RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Receive instructions from Design Engineering Management and/or Responsible Design Engineer as assigned.
  • Perform assignments with instruction on specific objectives. Evaluate, select, and apply standard software design coding practice, engineering techniques, procedures, and criteria, utilizing good judgment.
  • Prepare test plans to fully exercise features of products according to provided specifications. Execute test plans and evaluate results.
  • Troubleshoot problems and issues with products.
  • Expand capability with engineering tools including learning new tools as assigned.
  • The position of Intern in Mechanical Engineering is provided to allow Engineering Students the opportunity to practice in industry while assisting in activities within the mechanical development discipline.
  • Position accountability is based on close supervision and includes responsibility for accuracy of design and calculations, success of proposed adaptations and modifications to existing designs, and follow-up to completion of assigned activities.
  • Procedures exist that outline the processes utilized for product development/design and modification.
  • Writes and issues technical specifications and reports related to own activities within SSE projects and/or operations.
  • Assists in the development of design basis for projects and/or manufacturing operations.
REQUIREMENTS:
  • Intern must be pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering Technology and be at least a second year (Sophomore) student.
  • The incumbent should have knowledge of Linux, JavaScript, C/C++ and assembly language programming.
  • Knowledge of Python, and communications protocols such as TCP, TCP/IP, HTTP, MODBUS, MQTT (etc.) is considered a plus.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Analytical and logical reasoning.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office products.
  • Work is performed primarily in an office or lab environment.
  • During the course of product witness testing or product testing there may be exposure to flow test lab conditions where there may be more significant temperature swings, higher level of noise and dust, and exposure to petroleum products.
  • Basic knowledge in engineering
  • Show evidence of good organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Service/Customer oriented
  • Ability to work in a team-oriented environment and project culture
  • Good command of English

Job Description: 2021 AI Research Intern (NLP/ML)

Job Location: Mountain View, CA

Job Type: Spring/Summer Internship

Department: AI Research

NLP Research Intern

JD.com AI Research is looking for student interns to work on research areas in natural language processing, including natural language understanding, natural language generation, spoken dialog systems, question answering, machine reading comprehension, and knowledge graph learning.

Qualifications:
Ph.D. or masters degree in computer science or NLP related field.

Ability to communicate/collaborate with other researchers/engineers including our team members in China (ability to speak Chinese is NOT required).

Ability to implement experiments using scripting languages (Python, Perl, bash) and tools written in C/C++.

Experience working with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Torch, Mxnet, CNTK, etc.) and related tools in each special field.

Publication record in top NLP conferences (ACL, NAACL, EMNLP, NIPS, SIGIR, WWW etc) is a plus.

Machine Learning Research Intern

JD AI Research is looking for student interns to work on a wide variety of research areas in machine learning, including knowledge graph, deep learning, reinforcement learning, representation learning, etc.

Qualifications:
Ph.D. or master's degree in computer science, machine learning related field.

Ability to communicate/collaborate with other researchers/engineers including our team members in China (ability to speak Chinese is NOT required)

Ability to implement experiments using scripting languages (Python, Perl, bash) and tools written in C/C++.

Experience working with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Torch, Mxnet, CNTK, etc.) and related tools in each special field;

Publication record in top conferences (ICML, ICLR, NIPS, KDD, IJCAI, AAAI etc ) is a plus.

About JD.com and Silicon Valley Labs

JD.com is China's largest online retailer and the biggest overall retailer, as well as the country's biggest Internet company by revenue. In 2017, JD.com reported a net revenue that reached 362.3 billion CNY (US$55.689 billion), an increase of 40.3 percent year-over-year. Google, Walmart, Tencent, Intel, and Farfetch are our strategic partners.

JD.com sets the standard for online shopping through its commitment to quality, authenticity, and its vast product offering covering everything from fresh food and apparel to electronics and cosmetics. Its unrivaled nationwide fulfillment network provides standard same-day and next-day delivery, covering a population of more than 1 billion with a level of service and speed that is unmatched globally.

As a technology-driven company, JD.com is the world's leading company in high tech and AI delivery through drones, autonomous technology, and robots, and possesses the largest drone delivery system, infrastructure, and capability in the world. Our global R&D efforts are headquartered at Silicon Valley Labs in Mountain View, CA. The Silicon Valley Labs focus on building technology and services that will improve user experience and empower our business partners. Areas of research and development include: artificial intelligence, autonomous driving, robotics, computer vision, natural language processing, machine and deep learning, big data, and AR/VR.

Visit https://corporate.jd.com/ for more information.

About J D AI Research (JDAIR)

JD AI Research (JDAIR) focuses on the continuous innovation and optimization of algorithms to meet our developing business needs. Significant areas of research include natural language processing, spoken dialog systems, computer vision, and machine learning (including deep learning and reinforcement learning). JDAIR has established research centers in Beijing and Silicon Valley, and we are in the process of opening an additional research center in Europe.

Visit https://air.jd.com/ for more information.

Job Description:


About BDP International:

BDP International is a privately held, family-owned non-asset based global logistics provider with annual sales exceeding $2.1 billion USD. Founded in 1966 by Richard Bolte Sr. and based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, BDP has grown to be one of the largest logistics providers in the world. BDP employs more than 4,100 people worldwide, and operates freight logistics centers in 270 cities across the world through a global network of wholly owned offices, joint ventures and affiliates in 135 countries.

The company serves more than 4,000 customers worldwide. Clients include Bayer, Dow, DuPont, Heineken USA, Honeywell, Johnson & Johnson, Revlon, Trek Bicycle, Wacker, and others.

Your Mission

We are looking to explore how AI/ML techniques can enhance our ability to solve various pre-defined business issues. Opportunities exist in the categories of prediction (leading to automation), exception identification and handling and revenue enhancement. You will work within our global IT team, analyzing defined opportunities and helping to guide us to productive data endeavors. As a vital team member you will explore, benchmark and improve approaches to the provided opportunities. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the development and implementation of novel ideas and methods in the pursuit of better business outcomes.

Your Tasks

  • Determine the opportunities provided with the most likely positive outcomes
  • Conduct research in machine learning and optimization for the opportunities provided
  • Propose the best approaches to develop the optimal outcomes to each opportunity
  • Collaborate with the development teams to assist them in moving your research to production models



Job Requirements:
  • Demonstrated deep understanding of machine learning
  • Personal enjoyment in applying ML theory to solve real business problems
  • Have or are in the process of completing a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other relevant field
  • Enjoy finding solutions to new problems
  • Ability to work productively in independent research and analysis

Work hours and location will be flexible.


Please note: There is no relocation or immigration assistance associated with this opening.

Compensation based on experience. We offer a very competitive salary, matching 401(k) and casual dress environment.


Please visit our website: www.bdpinternational.com
*** This is a great opportunity to advance your career! Come join our growing BDP team!***

Job Description


Intel's Technology Development Analytics and Technology Automation (TD ATA) organization hires talented software engineers to develop, test, and support factory automation systems that enable Intel to manufacture leading edge semiconductors. As a Software Engineer Intern within TD ATA Automation you will partner with other software engineers on development and validation of quality reliable software systems. Responsibilities may include but are not limited to: designing and developing applications, developing databases, providing data analysis and recommendations, enabling automated software testing, executing regression test cases, creating technical documentation.

The ideal candidate should demonstrate:

  • Written and oral communication skills
  • Analytical problem solving and troubleshooting skills
  • Teamwork skills and collaboration skills
  • Tolerance of ambiguity and self-motivation


This is an internship and compensation will be given accordingly based on candidate education level and internship duration.


Qualifications


You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Knowledge and/or experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work, classes, research, relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Pursuing a masters degree or PhD degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related discipline
  • 6+ months of experience working with foundation in computer science principles


Preferred:

6+ months of working knowledge in one ore more of the following areas:

  • Object Oriented Programming (e.g. C#, C++, Java)
  • Knowledge of Microsoft development tools Visual Studio NET
  • Microsoft or Linux operating systems
  • Oracle or Microsoft database technologies

Inside this Business Group


As the world's largest chip manufacturer, Intel strives to make every facet of semiconductor manufacturing state-of-the-art - from semiconductor process development and manufacturing, through yield improvement to packaging, final test and optimization, and world class Supply Chain and facilities support. Employees in the Technology and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth

US, Oregon, Hillsboro

Job Description


In this internship, you will be a member of the Data Center Design Power and Performance (DCD PnP) team. The DCD PnP team is responsible for projecting and optimizing the power, binsplit, thermals, and power-limited performance for Data Center products including Xeon, Xeon-D, and Atom-based SoCs. We offer exciting opportunities to develop technical depth and leadership.

Internship responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Identifying RTL and physical power optimization opportunities by reviewing power estimation tool results
  • Modeling power consumption of IPs and SOCs
  • Automating tasks to improve PnP methodologies and efficiency


The ideal candidate will also demonstrate the following traits:

  • Skilled in effective communication and teamwork
  • Analytically-driven with strong problem-solving skills
  • A resourceful and disciplined self-starter
  • Thorough and detail-oriented


Qualifications


Minimum Requirements

The candidate must have a Bachelor's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or Computer Science and be pursuing a Master’s or PhD’s degree in one of the same fields.

6+ months experience with:

  • Pre-Si power analysis and modeling
  • Power-aware design
  • Industry-standard design and power estimation tools
  • Programming or scripting, preferably in perl, python, or TCL
  • General computer architecture and digital circuit design concepts

Inside this Business Group


Xeon Performance Group (XPG) delivers custom server SoC design solutions to our data center customers. It is chartered to deliver data centric silicon that is high-performing, cost-effective, high-quality, and on schedule in way that increases market share and drives the best solutions for our customers.

US, Oregon, Hillsboro

description:
Experian is very excited to share this internship opportunity with you. Yes, we are still in the middle of a global pandemic but let’s not let that stop us! Our 2021 Summer Internship Program will be a remote experience this year (thanks COVID). But please be rest assured that we have plans in place to make sure you won’t miss a beat by not being in the office. You will be connected, supported and have great opportunities to gain valuable experience in a fast-paced, innovative global company.

Are you…

  • Programmer with hands-on experience in Java, Python, MySQL, Oracle, and Big Data technologies
  • Passionate and curious to solve business problems using technology
  • Interested in learning about AWS concepts and technology modernizations
  • A self-motivated team player and quick learner to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment
  • Curious to learn about the data analytics, technology transformation and product innovation

Interns will work on challenging and meaningful projects with a clear understanding of your contribution to our organization. The Internship Program is a full time 10-week program focused on providing you with practical business & technical experience in product development. The program will offer hands-on experience into the world of Experian. It allows participants to develop leadership skills, broaden their understanding of the concepts learned in school and "get a taste of the real world" before they are fully committed to it. Our program is designed to help you develop, build community and have fun.

What you’ll be doing

Throughout the program you will

  • Perform analysis and software development associated with our batch and transactional platforms
  • Hands-on programming to deliver new products or migrate existing technology components to cloud
  • Contribute in design discussions & architectural guilds to build end to end technical design
  • Work closely in AWS environment collaborating with infrastructure and corporate IT teams
  • Actively present in biweekly sprint demos and showcase developed functionality to larger platform engineering group and cross-functional stakeholders
  • Partner with different team members to gain understanding of business requirements and key product/program questions.
  • Receive guidance from more experienced team members & engineering managers.
  • Follow engineering processes, procedures and client requirements; recommend and/or implement improvements/ solutions to identify efficiencies.
  • Participate in Internship Program activities and events to include onboarding, product demos, educational activities, information sessions, and social events.
  • Collaborate with Engineering Managers, Scrum Masters and SMEs to develop critical product components in an Agile environment
  • Participate in Executive Speaker Series and learn about our Experian CIS business
  • Actively contribute Intern Projects Showcase to demonstrate the hands-on work delivered during internships

What your background looks like

  • Must be pursuing a bachelor’s or Master’s degree from an accredited college or university
  • Deep problem-solving skills to perform root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Hands-on programming experience in Java, Python, Databases, and AWS. Experience in Big data, Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, Scala a plus
  • Proven ability to work independently and make good decisions with minimal direction
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Attention to detail with focus on quality
  • Be comfortable in ambiguity and drive structure with project management and organizational skills

About us, but we’ll be brief

Experian is the world’s leading global information services company, unlocking the power of data to transform lives and create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We’re investing in the future, through new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow. We embrace our diversity yet share similar values and growth mindsets.

We are thrilled to share that FORTUNE has named Experian one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been named in the 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.


EOE including Disability/Veteran

Looking for Summer 2021 deep learning developer intern!

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to work with our experienced software engineers to build and enhance MATLAB deep learning features. This position requires someone who has an eye for detail and is passionate about improving the integration between MATLAB and other deep learning libraries such as TensorFlow and Pytorch.

As an intern, you will receive a combination of practical experience and training in a work environment that fosters and rewards cooperation, teamwork, learning, and fun.

This internship will prepare you for a career at MathWorks starting in our Engineering Development Group (EDG).

Responsibilities

After training on MathWorks development processes and tools, you will work with the statistics and machine learning team on:

    Testing importing and exporting of deep learning models

    Helping to explore, design, develop and maintain connections with open-source deep learning frameworks

    Implementing custom versions of network layers

    Writing deep learning examples using the co-execution approach or model-exchange approach

Minimum Qualifications

    Candidates must be pursuing a master's level or a PhD level degree in a technical discipline.

    Experience with MATLAB

    Experience with C++

    Experience with Deep Learning

Additional Qualifications

    Pursuing an MS or PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with a strong academic record

    Experience implementing deep learning or machine learning features

    Experience using deep learning libraries such as TensorFlow or Pytorch

    Experience in programming and object-oriented design

    Strong communication skills

    3 months full-time commitment

position: Deep Learning/Computer Vision Intern - Fall 2021 - Masters/Ph.D
description:
As a Machine Learning Intern, you will be working with a team of Machine Learning professionals who apply various cutting-edge machine learning and statistical techniques to real-life use-cases and provide actionable insights to the business. You will have the opportunity of working with Norfolk Southern’s big data analytics platform and mine massive amounts of data using various toolsets like R, Python, Spark, TensorFlow, Keras, OpenCV, Hive, etc.

Principal Duties

  • Design, develop, and implement novel computer vision algorithms for unique use cases.
  • Design and build novel/custom CNN architectures.
  • Evaluate accuracy and quality of the designed models as well as data sources.
  • Stay up to date with the latest models and changes in the technology.
  • Design and develop production ready code.
  • Communicate results and implications to colleagues and business partners.
  • Coordinate with application development teams to integrate developed models with existing applications.

Technical Skills:

  • Excellent knowledge of Python programing (numpy, scipy, pandas, sklearn, scikit-image, matplotlib)
  • Hands-on experience with TensorFlow, Keras and/or PyTorch
  • Hands-on experience with image processing using Deep Learning (semantic segmentation, object detection, classification)
  • Familiarity with various CNN architectures (VGG, ResNet, MobileNet, YOLO, Faster RCNN, etc)
  • Experience with traditional image processing techniques (e.g. use of OpenCV, skimage)

Education:

Masters’ required, Ph.D. preferred in following fields:
Preferred Majors: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Engineering – Statistics, Engineering - Systems Engineering, Mathematical Sciences - Applied Mathematics, or Physics


Must be able to work 40 hours a week in our Atlanta office for 3 months during Fall 2021.


Compensation

Graduate Student - $3,666/month

  • Living stipend of $850/month is available to those who qualify.
  • Sponsorship may be available to those who qualify.

Work Conditions

Environment: Office

Shift Work: No

On-Call: No

Weekend Work: No

Travel Required: occasionally

position: Software Engineer - Full Stack Web - Intern
description:
We are a stealth startup building perception systems for autonomy. We are based in the San Francisco Bay Area, funded by NEA (https://www.nea.com/), and our core team includes faculty entrepreneurs (Stanford and UC Santa Barbara) and industry veterans (Uber, Apple, Amazon Lab126, Rohde & Schwarz), who have successfully shepherded signal processing and machine learning innovations to large-scale software for location improvement and safety at Uber, led the development of state-of-the-art computer vision technologies that shipped over millions of Amazon devices, and delivered zero-to-one product experiences at Uber and Box. Our core product grew out of 5+ years of university R&D by our co-founders. You can find out more about us by visiting our website (https://www.plato.systems/).

Our mission and team expertise spans beyond software to advanced sensor systems, algorithms, embedded systems, signal processing, and machine learning. Our team is building and deploying edge software and cloud services for real-time customer facing products as well as internal big data tools. We look for people with a depth of expertise and experience in one of these areas, and with the intellectual curiosity for interacting with, learning from, and teaching world-class experts in areas outside their expertise.

We currently have an exciting paid internship opportunity for full stack web application development in San Carlos, CA. You will join a multi-disciplinary group of scientists and engineers and will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional product and research teams. An ideal candidate will have a proven track record of driving zero-to-one innovation for large-scale system projects.

Responsibilities

  • Work on web applications and cloud based back-end services.
  • Contribute to the definition, development, integration, test, documentation, and support of software applications across multiple cloud and edge platforms.
  • Work in a data driven environment, drive process improvement, and work with the stakeholders to translate high-level, ambiguous business goals to working software solutions.
  • Contribute towards the software development as well as the architecture of software solutions.
  • Ensure scalability, availability and data security for your services.
  • Own, troubleshoot & resolve code defects.
  • Implement best practices for software development and documentation, and making sure designs meet requirements.
  • Implement test driven unit and end to end testing of any code you develop.
  • Prepare technical requirements and software design specifications.
  • Deliver high quality work under tight deadlines.

Required Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • 3+ months experience working on production software.
  • Experience building production type software, leveraging basic OO design/development skills, and practicing solid documentation methods.
  • Experience with at least one modern web programming languages. (Golang, Node/JavaScript, and Python).
  • Experience with at least one modern web application frontend and backend frameworks (Vue.js, ReactJS, Go net/http, gRPC, Express.JS, ...).
  • Experienced with open-source technologies (including GNU/Linux, Bash/Zsh, Protocol Buffers).
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services, e.g., S3, SQS, EC2, RDS, CloudFormation, Redshift or equivalent experience in Google Cloud, Azure or other.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 1+ years experience working on production software.
  • Experience with a client-server application model. Experience working with microservice architecture environments is a plus.
  • Experience developing production web applications, preferably at a large-scale in high-traffic environments. Experience with full-stack production-grade web frameworks and tools are a plus, for example Node.js, React (and JSX), Webpack, SASS/Less.
  • Experience successfully planning, organizing, and conducting software development projects in a dynamic environment. Experience with code review and task management processes are a plus.
  • Hands-on experience with modern infrastructure technologies, such as Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Vault, Packer, Spinnaker, Istio, and Envoy.
  • Experience interacting with and managing databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Cassandra, ...) and/or key-value stores. (e.g. Redis, memcached, …)
  • Experience developing cloud software services and understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability.
  • Experience defining, developing and maintaining web service API's.
  • Experience supporting machine learning applications and data scientists.
  • Ability to define system architecture and explore the feasibility of various designs.
  • Experience with Big Data technologies, e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Hive, Kafka ...
  • Likes California

Kodak Alaris is a global technology company that's delivering future value through customer solutions. Our advanced, patented intellectual property combines breakthrough technologies, digital transformation, and human know-how to unlock the power of images and information. We make businesses run faster, governments run smarter and provide consumers innovative solutions to preserve and enjoy their most cherished memories. Our future is powered by our employees' creativity. Expect a lot from Kodak Alaris and know that we expect a lot of ourselves and the performance of the company.

Kodak Moments

Kodak Moments is a leading global provider of photo products and services to retailers, consumers, and entertainment properties. We inspire consumers to bring their memories to life--delivering innovative, high-quality photo products and experiences they find truly meaningful. Powered by over 100,000 consumer touchpoints across 30 countries globally, it's our mission to be the brand consumers choose to celebrate and preserve life's memories, from the big events to the everyday moments that matter.

Position Summary

The ideal candidate is knowledgeable of and has experience using RESTful APIs. The ideal candidate, working with our cloud platform team, will develop and deliver automated smoke tests using Postman and Newman and hooking these tests into our DevOps pipelines as deployment checkpoints. The platform makes it easy for our internal clients (Mobile and Web) to create personalized imaging products that can be fulfilled in-store in hours or mailed directly to their home through central lab in days. You will learn a lot work closely with the team to design, develop and test complex application software in a modern development environment using Agile Develop techniques and processes.

The individual will work on-site in our Rochester, NY office.

Key Responsibilities

Develop Automated API Tests using Postman.

Enable system deployment utilizing DevOps best practices.

Update pipelines to use test results to determine goodness and readiness to deploy code.

Create Postman Monitors to show build/test status results

Job Requirements
Qualifications & Experience

Knowledge and experience with restful APIs.

Understanding of DevOps practices.

Experience automating and testing cloud solutions to verify deployment readiness. (Postman, Advanced Rest Client other tools).

Experience with Microsoft technologies (Visual Studio .Net, C#, CosmosDB, NuGet, and SQL).

Excellent problem solving and analytical skills

Great communication skills, work ethic and willingness to be a team player

Working on obtaining a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related engineering discipline.

Skills & Competencies

Cloud computing knowledge with AWS, Azure or Google Cloud

C#, NodeJS, WCF, HTTP/HTTPS, REST, JSON, XML

Git, NuGet, Microsoft DevOps, CI/CD pipelines

D atabase systems SQL, NoSQL, CosmosDB

Intern Job Description:

Øptimus Analytics, a data science and software company, is seeking a data science intern in their Washington D.C. area office or remotely for the summer term. Interns with the Data Science & Predictive Analytics team will participate in all aspects of work at Øptimus. In an environment where a “long-term” project lasts one or two weeks, no two days are the same. You won't be getting coffee. You'll sit in on meetings and work on multiple projects: writing call scripts that are used in hundreds of thousands of calls, streamlining our current workflow, and creating statistical models to meet the needs of our clients, just to name a few. You'll be doing the work that a full-time employee does. We'll match what you're good at with what you enjoy and what we need.

Our internships are mostly geared towards those still in school, whether undergraduate or graduate students as well as recent graduates. This job posting is for the summer 2021 period, with flexible starting dates between May and June full time preferred but part-time considered. We don't guarantee full-time employment after an internship, but we're a growing firm and are always looking for bright, hard-working talent. If you're looking for a full-time job, this is a good first step and puts you ahead of the competition!

Qualifications:

  • Must be able to learn quickly and juggle multiple projects with moving deadlines.
  • Must have strong analytical skills.
  • Must have at least one course in quantitative research such as statistics or applied research.
  • Must have courses or experience in machine learning, data mining, regression, generalized linear models, experimental design, and/or GIS
  • Must have killer Excel skills and be incredibly competent in Word, PowerPoint
  • Must have experience in R or Python - both are a plus!
  • Experience with computer programming is a plus.
  • Experience with statistical modeling is a plus.


Compensation:

Internships with Øptimus are paid commensurate with professional and academic experience on a 1099 basis.

Company:

Øptimus Analytics is a family of statisticians, graphic designers, data scientists, programmers, social media marketing analysts, and recovering politicos. Since its founding in 2013, Øptimus has been at the forefront of developing innovative data and analytics software platforms. Øptimus has designed and delivered data-driven strategies for leading political campaigns, Fortune 500 companies, and non-profits around the globe.

We handle a wide variety of projects and use many different technologies and programs to meet our clients' needs, so our culture here is one of constant learning and curiosity, while doing things the right way. We boast office space in a beautiful building on the Old Town Alexandria waterfront near the yellow and blue Metro lines, no cubicles, a nacho cheese machine, and free staff lunch on Wednesdays. If you work remotely with Øptimus, you will be provided with a company issued laptop and the same training, tools and support offered to our in-office staff. If you live by the "work hard, play hard" philosophy, then you'll be a great fit with the Øptimus team.

Under general supervision, the qualified candidate evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering and technology principles and techniques to assigned business problems. The candidate will work in a distributed team environment on projects that have low to moderate impact on the business. The candidate ensures that results meet established needs, goals, and timelines.

The qualified candidate for this position will work with a team of product management, business analysts and software developers on sales tools (selection and rating software) for YORK chiller products. The candidate will be responsible for scope development, coordination, testing and reporting progress on their work to support migration to a new software platform.

The job starts remote (because the office is closed), but will be an on-site when the office re-opens. Specific duties include:

  • Designs, develops, documents, and tests software solutions in accordance with project specifications, ensuring completion within the planned time constraint and meeting the established objectives for quality, reliability and performance. Uses judgment in suggesting adaptations or modifications where appropriate.
  • Researches technical and competitive information on product lines.
  • Develops, documents and executes test plans and sequences for software quality assurance.
  • Manage small projects and tasks with the support of the business team. Intern will be exposed to various aspects of the equipment business and team members, and present on at least one specific assignment to management.

  • Provides both technical and administrative documentation in a timely manner for developed software and design models.
  • Adheres to the Company’s Code of Conduct and Business Ethics standards.

Qualifications


What we look for
Required Qualification:

  • A junior or senior level student in a Bachelor Degree program in Computer Science; or a senior level student in a Bachelor Degree program in Engineering, Science, or Mathematics discipline with strong Computer Science skills.
  • The candidate willusually have limited (less than oneto twoyears)software development experience inC#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScriptor related high-level languages.
  • Some experience in relational database management systems and SQL.
  • Proficiency withMicrosoftWindows operating systemsandMS Office Suite programs.
  • Ability to manipulate large data collections in both databases and spreadsheets.
  • Ability to understand technical material.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with engineers, analysts, marketing personnel, designers, and drawing and software developers.
  • Ability to work independentlywith good organizational skills and the flexibility and adaptability to work on multiple projectswith exceptional attention to detail.
  • High degree of interpersonal skills including both oral and written communication.
  • Ability to assimilate and implement new and emerging technologies.
  • Customer-Focused: You start with the customer and work backwards. You invest the time and energy to understand your customers’ objectives, and then tie all your activities directly to the achievement of those objectives.
  • An Effective Communicator: You write and speak clearly and concisely. You actively inform and inspire with your messaging. You speak plainly and are transparent with your business colleagues.
  • Tech-Savvy: You have the ability to learn and use new software tools and programs
  • Action-Oriented: You thrive as a self-starter who proactively senses and responds to problems and opportunities.
  • Innately Curious: Asking questions is how you learn. You thrive on interaction with experienced professionals and seek to incorporate over-arching strategies into the task at hand.
  • Results-Driven: You are awesome at setting your own daily priorities and delivering projects on time that match requirements and expectations.

About Zapata

Zapata computing is a software, services, and applications company whose mission is to advance humankind with revolutionary science and engineering by delivering quantum advantage to enterprise customers. We develop quantum-ready algorithms, applications, and solutions built on a workflow-based platform for enterprise data analytics.

We are committed to creating an environment that accelerates our employee’s growth and positive impact in the world. Our Quantum AI team is highly collaborative and cross-disciplinary to meet the fast-changing field. Our world-class quantum researchers and engineers are creative, curious, and resourceful problem solvers with a revolutionary mindset.


About the job

The Zapata Quantum AI team is building a portfolio of next-generation quantum machine learning tools and algorithms to be deployed on state-of-the-art hardware through Orquestra, Zapata’s workflow management platform. As a Quantum AI Software Intern, you will work with the team to design, develop, productionize, and maintain these algorithms and tools. A few examples of the Quantum AI team’s recent work:

  • Quantum-inspired models for enhanced combinatorial optimization (arXiv:2101.06250).
  • Generative modeling with quantum-classical hybrid architectures (arXiv:2012.03924).
  • Data-driven initialization and analysis techniques for parametrized quantum circuits (arXiv:2103.08572).

Internships during summer 2021 are preferred, but later dates will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Although internships can be performed remotely from any location and at flexible work hours, interns will be expected to be available on occasions during U.S. Eastern Daylight Time (EDT) or Central European Summer Time (CEST) working hours.


Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, product-ionize, and maintain quantum AI tools and algorithms and integrations with quantum computing libraries.
  • Support researchers at Zapata who use the tools that you build.

Team values

  • Team success as a shared accomplishment with diversity in thought and experience.
  • Open communication and willingness to respectfully engage with others.

Minimum qualifications

Preferred qualifications

  • Familiarity with fundamental concepts in quantum computing.
  • Familiarity with quantum computing frameworks such as Qiskit, Cirq, pyQuil, Q#, or machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
  • Experience developing complex technical software as part of a team.
  • Someone who is a self-starter, adaptable, and ready to learn.

contractors and the public.

parks projects, construction administration, bidding, and estimating is desired.

Responsibilities :
  • Create and maintain HR metrics reporting and HRIS data audits;
  • Create and maintain job descriptions and update HRIS career path specifications;
  • Analyze internal and external sources of compensation-related data and recommended modification to company pay structure as requested;

  • Assist with other department projects as needed.
Qualifications :

  • Strong analytical, written and oral communication skills; and
  • Excellent computer skills, especially a strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground-breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities.

Job Description


Responsibilities may be quite diverse of a software technical nature. Experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job. Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short periods during breaks from school. You will be creatively applying your technical know-how (engineering fundamentals, scientific knowledge, systems thinking, analytical thinking, prototyping, and testing knowledge) against design constraints and boundary conditions (industrial design, cost, performance criteria and other design constraints) to research, develop and productive mass producible solutions. This requisition is for the IOTG Intern Program in 2021. Specific project details and manager assignment will be communicated prior to the start of the internship with a candidate offer. Offers must be accepted or declined by spring 2021. All internships will be virtual - no onsite or lab internships.

  • Self-motivated individual willing to take and follow directions and deliver to schedule

  • Strong communication, interpersonal and active listening skills

  • Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills, problem/conflict resolution skills

  • Effective prioritization and time management skills

  • Demonstrated leadership capabilities

  • Proactive, resourceful and self-motivated with strong analytical skills

  • Good communication, writing and documentation skills

Candidate must be currently enrolled in a BS program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related engineering program.

Minimum 3+ months of experience or equivalent coursework in the following areas:

  • Programming in one or more languages like C*, C++*, C*, Perl*, Python*, SQL* etc.

Inside this Business Group


Employees of the Internet of Things Solutions Group (IOTG) have an exciting opportunity before them: To grow Intel's leadership position in the rapidly evolving IoT market by delivering the best silicon, software and services that meet a wide range of customer requirements - from Intel® Xeon® to Intel® Quark®. The group, a fresh, dynamic collaboration between Intel's Intelligent Solutions Group and Wind River Systems, utilizes assets from across all of Intel in such areas as industrial automation, retail, automobiles and aerospace. The IOTG team is dedicated to helping Intel drive the next major growth inflection through productivity and new business models that are emerging as a result of IoT.


Other Locations

US, California, Santa Clara;US, Oregon, Portland


Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

Company Description


Guardant Health is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer globally through use of its proprietary blood tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. The Guardant Health Oncology Platform leverages capabilities to drive commercial adoption, improve patient clinical outcomes and lower healthcare costs across all stages of the cancer care continuum. Guardant Health has launched liquid biopsy-based Guardant360®, Guardant360 CDx and GuardantOMNI® tests for advanced stage cancer patients. These tests fuel development of its LUNAR program, which aims to address the needs of early stage cancer patients with neoadjuvant and adjuvant treatment selection, cancer survivors with surveillance, asymptomatic individuals eligible for cancer screening and individuals at a higher risk for developing cancer with early detection.


Job Description


Guardant Health is a molecular diagnostics company is focused on building minimally invasive blood-based tools to aid in the management and treatment of patients with cancer. To help identify cancer at the earliest stages, we are developing blood-based tests that seek to increase screening rates and overcome the technical and clinical challenges of existing screening methods. We are leveraging data from tens of thousands of patients with cancer to develop tests with high sensitivity and specificity for the early detection of cancer in screen-eligible, asymptomatic individuals and individuals at a higher risk for developing cancer.

A major goal of the Medical Affairs program is to educate leading physicians, policy makers, physician groups, and advocacy groups on the clinical value of Guardant Health’s products and generate robust clinical validity and clinical utility data for our products to support reimbursement and guideline adoption. The role of the Intern, Medical Affairs will be to support the development of key resources to support these goals.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Critically review data from new publications and research findings to develop educational tools (publications/presentation, etc)
  • Develop new and organize existing team resource pages
  • Synopsize emerging abstracts and publications relevant to CRC screening as well as adjuvant and metastatic treatment in target cancer types
  • Assist in agenda planning and meeting facilitation of Clinical Advisory Board(s) as needed.
  • Participate in medical updates, scientific presentations, journal clubs, teleconferences, and meetings as requested.

Qualifications


Technical Skills (Required)

  • Intermediate-to-advanced knowledge of the following computer software programs: Microsoft Office: Powerpoint, Excel, and Word
  • Ability to work independently while maintaining a strong teamwork ethic.
  • Multi-dimensional in abilities to work on simultaneous tasks and work cross-team.
  • Self-directed, intrinsically motivated, flexible to changes in an ever-changing dynamic environment.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, good attention to detail, time management skills, and personal initiative.
  • Excellent proofreading skills, with the ability to proof for proper grammar, spelling, punctuation, and formatting of documents.

Education/Experience (Required)

  • Currently enrolled students in an undergraduate or graduate program in a scientific field of study. Juniors and graduating seniors are strongly encouraged to apply
  • Interested in a career in the sciences, health care, or clinical trials

Additional Information


Physical Requirements

  • Employee may frequently exert up to 20-50 pounds of force to push or lift equipment
  • This position requires standing/walking/crawling regularly

Employee may be required to lift routine office supplies and use office equipment. Majority of the work is performed in a desk/office environment; however, there may be exposure to high noise levels, fumes, and biohazard material in the laboratory environment. Ability to sit for extended periods of time.

Guardant Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

position: Research Intern - Joint MSR-Planner/Project Research Internships
description:
Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

The Language and Intelligent Assistance group focuses on advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning and natural language processing for intelligent assistance, with an emphasis on developing technologies to be transferred to innovative Microsoft products.

We are seeking candidates for several research internship positions in collaboration with the Microsoft Planner and Microsoft Project product teams. These joint MSR-Planner/Project internships present a unique opportunity both to tackle challenging research problems and develop real world solutions for enterprise task management systems. This can include problems in task understanding and task completion assistance. We also aim to publish the results in top-tier ML and NLP venues. Candidates should have experience in natural language processing (e.g., semantic representations, intent detection, structured prediction tasks), deep learning (e.g., weakly supervised learning, domain adaptation of pretrained embeddings), or intelligent assistance (e.g., personalization, task completion assistance, document recommendations).

This is an environment where interns can learn, collaborate, and network for life while acquiring unique insights into the world of enterprise-scale software development.

Research internships are offered year-round, though they typically begin in late spring/early summer.

Responsibilities

Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world’s best researchers, interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, students are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer.

Qualifications

In addition to the qualifications below, you’ll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter.


Required Qualifications

  • Must be currently accepted or enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science or a related STEM field.
  • Must have at least 1 year of experience in conducting research in one or more areas of Computer Science or a related STEM field. Time spent in a graduate program counts towards this requirement.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Should be able to independently execute a research agenda and collaborate effectively with other researchers and engineers.
  • Should have relevant research contributions, such as peer-reviewed publications in top-tier conferences and journals.
  • Should have strong communication skills.
Candidates who may not have all these qualifications are encouraged to apply.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Our vision in Enterprise Products group is to lead and champion the modern accelerated datacenter with enhanced communications and IO technologies. With datacenter as the new unit of computing, we are tasked to show the world that NVIDIA is the datacenter company, make IO as a first-class citizen of business enterprise, and to communicate how it will transform lives and change the world. We are a world-class, customer-centric products team, mastering to engage individuals with meaningful and authentic experiences.

NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. Today, we are increasingly known as “the AI computing company” and we are looking to grow our company and strengthen the team with the smartest people in the world.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Shape and promote NVIDIA’s brand voice through development of digital marketing campaigns and storytelling.

  • Manage execution of multiple projects such as creating assets, outbound communications, supporting demand generation programs and managing digital events.

  • Collaborate with multiple business units across the enterprise to communicate NVIDIA’s value.

  • Research the top use cases and pain points for our target personas in various industries.

What we need to see:

  • Project management experience as well as excellent communication, prioritization, listening, and teamwork skills.

  • Pride yourself in doing phenomenal work, being organized and excel at multitasking.

  • Have an understanding of marketing principals.

  • You're agile, responsive and have a passion to learn and try new things.

  • Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in marketing, business, and/or computer science

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Outstanding writing skills

  • Experience executing digital marketing campaigns

  • Understanding of computer gaming, AI, computing or datacenter

  • You have experience launching an enterprise product

  • You are pursuing your MBA

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers; we have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unparalleled growth, best-in-class teams are rapidly growing. If you’re creative and autonomous with a real passion for your work, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

FleishmanHillard’s St. Louis is seeking qualified candidates for full-time paid Creative intern positions. Interns are an integral part of our teams, giving participants real-life experience and skills that will help them succeed in their communications careers in the future.

FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Deadlines for Fall submissions: July 1
The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least five months (September 1, 2021 – January 14, 2022)
Responsibilities:
ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS
Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite.

COPYWRITERS
Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program.
  • A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

VIDEO EDITORS
Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
  • A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
  • Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS
Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
  • Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
  • Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS
Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
  • Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.
  • Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.
  • Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills.
  • A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office.
Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have at least a 3.2 GPA, previous relevant internship experience(s) and completed their junior year of college, though recent graduates are preferred. All candidates must also exhibit a desire and motivation to learn and the ability to work as part of a team.

Your Application Submission Must Include All of the Following:

  • Resume
  • Portfolio
  • Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
  • Transcript (can be unofficial)

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 82 million registered learners as of March 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. More than 6,000 institutions have used Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students, including in high-demand fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.

Coursera’s Engineering teams are responsible for maintaining a scalable and reliable platform. Engineering works to build interactive products for the worldwide learner community. As an engineer at Coursera, you will be empowered to build well-engineered products that shape new platform features and advance our technical infrastructure. You will be encouraged to build reliable, scalable, testable, and efficient systems.

During the 16-week internship, you'll be embedded as a member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect millions of learners worldwide!

This internship will run from August 30 - December 17. It will be fully remote, but you will need to work remotely from within the United States. We will begin reviewing applications on May 24.

Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!

Basic Qualifications:

    • Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship

Preferred Qualifications:

    • Currently pursuing a B.A./B.S. Degree or higher in Computer Science, or related technical field
    • Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design
    • Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, school projects or coding competitions.
    • Self-motivated, hands-on, focused on impact, and able to operate under a great deal of independence

Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.

position: Student Intern- Orthopedic Surgery: MRI-based 3d Modeling
description:
Job Title: Student Intern- Orthopedic Surgery: MRI-based 3d Modeling
Department: Orthopedic Surgery
Shift: 1st
Specialty: Research
Job Number: 2021-1518
Date Posted: 05/04/2021
Position Type: Research

Job Qualifications:

At Rush University Medical Center, we are committed to advancing scientific medical knowledge through research. At RUMC we are expanding scientific frontiers in human disease to improve diagnosis and treatment. Are you looking to be a part of the exciting, always evolving and expanding new developments in research here at Rush University Medical Center?
If this describes you, you may be the right candidate for the Student Intern - MRI-based 3d Modeling position with the Department of Orthopedic Surgery.
Position Highlights:
Under direction of the Principal Investigator or his/her designee and in collaboration with other members of the research team, the Intern will process imaging data and create 3d models based on MRI images of the human hip under an established research design. . The intern will then use programming/scripting (Matlab and/or Python) techniques to analyze the resulting 3d models.
The individual who holds this position exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.

Position Responsibilities:
Creates 3d Models based on MRI using commercially available software for Segmentation (experience with Materialise Mimics preferred)
Writes own routines in Python/Matlab to automate the segmentation process and to analyze the resulting models.
Enters study-related data into computer databases.
Maintains and submits primary and summary documentation of laboratory work to principal investigator or designee.
Discusses problems with testing or research design with supervisor.
Attends relevant meetings of the research team.
Performs other duties as assigned by the Principal Investigator or designee.

Required Position Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Bioengineering/ Mechanical Engineering/ Electronics Engineering/ Medical Physics required with a focus/career interests on/in imaging and/or biomechanics
Imaging experience preferred
Working knowledge with MRI preferred
Programing experience with Matlab and/or Python strongly preferred
College course work in image processing, principles of magnetic resonance imaging, biomechanics, anatomy, programming, or related science; coursework must have included some laboratory components.
Demonstrated effective interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task, remain flexible, and manage time effectively.
Ability to perform procedures requiring manual dexterity and repetitive motions.
Analytical skills required to write scientific reports.
Proficiency with personal computers including Microsoft Office.

Preferred Position Qualifications:
This position could be a good fit for current medical students in good standing with their program or recent engineering/science bachelor graduates looking to go on a research gap year.
Physical Demands:

Company Highlights:
Rush was recently ranked among the top 20 hospitals in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.
Rush is one of the first medical colleges in the Midwest and one of the nation's top-ranked nursing colleges, as well as graduate programs in allied health, health systems management and biomedical research.
As an academic medical center, Rush University Medical Center in Chicago, Illinois, is committed to advancing medical knowledge through research. Investigators at Rush are involved in more than 1,600 projects, including hundreds of clinical studies to test the effectiveness and safety of new therapies and medical devices, as well as to expand scientific and medical knowledge.
The Association for the Accreditation of Human Research Protection Programs (AAHRPP) has awarded Rush full accreditation for three years. Rush is one of the first academic medical centers in Illinois to receive this accreditation.

Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
